SEARCH
Package manager

Class Roster

java.lang.Object
manager.Roster
public class Roster extends Object
Creates a Student roster object and implements all the major functionalities like add, remove, modify and sorting.
Author:
Raghunandan Wable, Srikumar Avirneni

  • Constructor Details

    • Roster

      public Roster()

  • Method Details

    • empty

      public boolean empty()
      Checks if the roster is empty based on size of roster array.
      Returns:
      true if the size is less than one otherwise false.

    • getRoster

      public Student[] getRoster()
      Returns the roster array of student object.
      Returns:
      the student roster array.

    • find

      private int find(Student student)
      Searches for the given student in the roster and returns its index in the array if present.
      Parameters:
      student - the student that needs to be searched for
      Returns:
      if student is found will return the position of the student, returns NOT_FOUND otherwise.

    • updateScholarshipStudent

      public boolean updateScholarshipStudent(Student rStudent, int scholarship)
      This method updates the scholarship of a student in roster.
      Parameters:
      rStudent - student for which the scholarship must be updated
      scholarship - the amount that needs to be added to scholarship for a student.
      Returns:
      true if student has been found and scholarship has been updated successfully, otherwise false.

    • grow

      private void grow()
      Method increases the array capacity by 4 if the array is full.

    • addStudent

      private void addStudent(Student student)
      helper method to add student after last student object in roster array
      Parameters:
      student - student that needs to be added.

    • statusChecker

      public boolean statusChecker(String status)
      The method checks if the enrolling student status is valid or not.
      Parameters:
      status - the status of student enrolled.
      Returns:
      true if status exists otherwise false.

    • add

      public boolean add(Student student)
      Checks for the size of the roster array and calls the add student method for adding the student after last student.
      Parameters:
      student - the student that needs to be added.
      Returns:
      true if student has been added, false otherwise.

    • rearrangeRoster

      private void rearrangeRoster(int position)
      Rearranges the roster when a student has been removed.
      Parameters:
      position - the position from which rearrangement of roster must be done.

    • remove

      public boolean remove(Student student)
      Removes the student from the roster and calls rearrangeRoster method so that the roster is rearranged without empty space.
      Parameters:
      student - the student that needs to be removed
      Returns:
      true if the student has been found and removed, false otherwise.

    • listBySchool

      public Student[] listBySchool(String schoolName)
      This method creates an array that contains all the students from a given school.
      Parameters:
      schoolName - the school name from which the student names must be listed.
      Returns:
      a Student array of students from that school.

    • changeMajor

      public void changeMajor(Profile profile, String major)
      Changes the major of student that has been entered.
      Parameters:
      profile - The profile for which major needs to be changed.
      major - The new major that should be replaced with the existing major.

    • contains

      public boolean contains(Student student)
      Checks if the student exists in the roster array.
      Parameters:
      student - the student that needs to be checked for in the roster.
      Returns:
      true if student exists in the roster, false otherwise.

    • containsProfile

      public Student containsProfile(Profile profile)
      Checks if the given profile exists in the student roster.
      Parameters:
      profile - the profile that needs to be searched for the roster.
      Returns:
      true if profile exists, false otherwise.

    • sortByName

      public Student[] sortByName(Student[] students, int arrayLength)
      Sorts the roster array by student last name, first name and DOB.
      Parameters:
      students - the array that needs to be sorted.
      arrayLength - length of the array that is being sorted.
      Returns:
      sorted array of students.

    • print

      public void print()
      Sorts the roster array students first name, last name and dob using sortByName helper method

    • compareMajor

      public int compareMajor(Major major1, Major major2)
      Compare one major enum with other one.
      Parameters:
      major1 - first major that is being compared.
      major2 - second major that is being compared with first one.
      Returns:
      value less than 0 if major 1 is less than major 2, value greater than 0 if major 1 is greater than major 2 and zero if major 1 and major 2 are same.

    • printBySchoolMajor

      public void printBySchoolMajor()
      print roster sorted by school, major

    • updateStudentCreds

      public void updateStudentCreds(Profile profile, int credits)
      Adding enrolled credits to completed credits.
      Parameters:
      profile - the profile for which completed credits must be added.
      credits - the number of credits that need to be added to completed credits.

    • printByStanding

      public void printByStanding()
      Prints roster by standing.
